citation.name: Neuromuscul. Disord.
citation.title: Mutation in TOR1AIP1 encoding LAP1B in a form of muscular dystrophy: a novel gene related to nuclear envelopathies.

comment.text: Required for nuclear membrane integrity. Induces TOR1A and TOR1B ATPase activity and is required for their location on the nuclear membrane. Binds to A- and B-type lamins. Possible role in membrane attachment and assembly of the nuclear lamina.
Interacts with ATP1B4. Interacts with TOR1A (ATP-bound). Interacts with TOR1B, TOR2A and TOR3A. Interacts with VIM.
Expressed in muscle, liver and kidney.

disease.name: Myopathy, autosomal recessive, with rigid spine and distal joint contractures
disease.description: An autosomal recessive degenerative myopathy characterized by muscle weakness initially involving the proximal lower limbs, followed by distal upper and lower limb muscle weakness and atrophy. Other features include joint contractures, rigid spine, and restricted pulmonary function. Cardiac involvement has been observed in some patients. Disease onset is in the first or second decades of life.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Autosomal recessive limb-girdle muscular dystrophy type 2Y
Expressed in bone marrow and 242 other tissues

feature.description: Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2)
In a breast cancer sample; somatic mutation; dbSNP:rs775134055.
